title: 240. Yes, the American Economy Is in a Funk -- But Not for the Reasons You Think
description: As sexy as the digital revolution may be, it can't compare to the Second Industrial Revolution (electricity! the gas engine! antibiotics!), which created the biggest standard-of-living boost in U.S. history. The only problem, argues the economist Robert Gordon, is that the Second Industrial Revolution was a one-time event. So what happens next?
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
